reference.shortdesc: The topicapply element identifies subjects that qualify the content for filtering or flagging but not retrieval. The topicapply element can identify a single subject. Additional subjects can be specified by nested subjectref elements.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The topicapply element is specialized from topicref. It is defined in the classification-domain module.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , , keyref, keys, collection-type, linking, processing-role and toc.

For this element:
The processing-role attribute has a default value of resource-only.
The toc attribute has a default value of no.

example.title: Example
example.p: The map content should be retrieved for Apache Tomcat and hidden as irrelevant for operating systems other than Red Hat or SUSE.
example.codeblock: <map> <title>Installing Apache Tomcat on RedHat or SuSE Linux</title> <topicsubject href="../controlledValues/tomcatServer.dita"/> <topicapply> <subjectref href="../controlledValues/redhatLinux.dita"/> <subjectref href="../controlledValues/suseLinux.dita"/> </topicapply> <!-- ... --> </map>
